It's your ole' pal Craig here. Back for another session of random rantings and such..or not. Anyhow, so there really hasn't been too much going on. Steph and I are still together. How that girl has put up with me this long and not murdered me..I swear I don't know. Honeslty, she's been like the most amazing thing that's happened to me in a long time. If it wasn't for her,I'd still be lost in the emptiness that was me back then. But anyhow, I'm back at McDonald's...again. It's horrible, but I'm hoping to get a phone call about a job at St. Luke's sometime in the next week or so..keep you fingers crossed. In the meantime, I've been checking newspaper ads and such..we'll see what happens. A couple of weeks ago I ran into Jess Cruz, who I haven't seen in ages. Anyhow, of course she had to bring up the past...and all the painful memories that come with it. Sometimes I wish we could shut the door on out pasts and not have to relive the hurt everytime someone brings it up, but no such luck. And naturally, the only memories she brings up are the ones that hurt the most..thanks Jess. You don't see me bringing up all her ex girlfriends,but anyhow, we talked about getting together sometime and playing since she still plays bass and I feel comfortable enough with my skill on the guitar to actually get together with someone and try and create some music. Right now I'm sitting at mom's house listening to some songs off the new Disturbed album, so far I'm liking it. Mom wanted me to go grocery shopping...right...the trauma from the Fashion Bug excursion combined with my loathing for grocery stores just set off all the warning signals that it wouldn't be in my best interest to go. Anyhow, that's about it for now. Just a hi to all the people I don't talk to as often as I used to. And to those that this applies, I'm sorry for anything I did that I shouldn't have and for all the things I did that I shouldn't have. Lately, I've been thinking about my past and how I've done some really uncool things. Thankfully, I'm not the same person I was then, so I know better now. I just wish there were some way I could make up for those things, so apologizing is the best thing I can do. I'm still amazed how songs seem to relate to how we feel, or what we've been through. So, here's another one. Oh one more thing, check out the prettiness that is my new and improved journal, done and created entirely by yours truly..I'm so proud of me. What a week it's been...

To start the week off, I got the new Mudvayne album, Lost And Found, very very bad ass. I've always loved how some bands can mature and you can really see it in their lyrics and feel it in the music itself.

Tuesday night my Aunt Jean died. She overdosed on some drug, I'm not sure which, but it doesn't really matter. She destroyed herself over the years, fought addiction for most of her life. Now, her battle is over and she can rest peacefully at last. I know I'll be finem I have my friends and more importantly, I have Steph. My mom is the one I worry about, she's been taking it kind of hard. She's one of the strongest women I  know, so I know she'll pull through.

And now on the brighter side of things. Steph and I just keep getting closer and closer. We took things kind of slow at first, but since we've become "official", things have moved pretty quickly. I'm not complaining, I haven't been this happy in such a long time, I'm just worried about how she sees it. I don't want things to move too fast and scare her away hehe. She surprised me yesterday by coming by after work while I was asleep. I woke up with her sitting on me, again proving that I can in fact wake up in a good mood. It is possible mwahahahaha.

It's kind of weird thought, when I was with Sarah and I would tell her I love her, I always meant it, but in some way, I never really felt it. But, with Steph, it's not like that. I look in her eyes and tell her I love her, and that is all I can feel. I don't quite know how to describe it.

Well, I'm off to call her now. Take care kiddies.

Why can't I escape my past? All I want is to turn my back on who I was and be the man I want to be now. But all it takes is being thrown back into some all-too-familiar situation and all those old, disgustingly familiar feelings come back to haunt me. And I can't stop them...God, how I wish I could. Just lock them away in some forgotten dungeon and let them collect mold and such.

I mean...I'm happy..genuinely happy. Happier than I've been in a long time. But, how do I blind myself to things I don't want to see, things I don't want to know about? If any of you know how, please tell me. I used to be able to hide any feeling of any type, at any given point in time, but lately I haven't been able to. I've just been opening my mouth or cracking my knuckles and letting it all out. Maybe it's better that way. I don't know...
